summary: In this context, nitrate is evaluated in relation to exercise performance under hypobaric hypoxia conditions. The study indicates that while sodium nitrate did not significantly enhance exercise performance compared to placebo, hypobaric hypoxia led to notable reductions in exercise metrics such as grip strength and oxygen saturation (SaO2). This suggests that hypoxia negatively impacts exercise performance, and while nitrate was tested, its effects were not significantly correlated with performance changes in hypoxic conditions.
